page.title: 02LANDSCAPE IN HAMBLEDON
page.content: {HISTORIC SITES IN HAMBLEDON.} {BURY LODGE:}remains of a Roman villa, excavated and covered up.{CHESTNUT {MEADOW:}Situated between Lott's shop and Hook Vinney; was the scene of a pre D-Day review by {GEORGE V1} in{l944.BROADHALFPENNY DOWN:} site of the famous matches of the Hambledon Cricket Club in the l8th century.{HISTORIC {BUILDINGS IN HAMBLEDON. KING'S {REST:}was the stable block of the old house belonging to Thomas Symonds, where Charles ll is supposed to have taken refuge.{ {THE GREEN MAN:}originally a cruck house c. l400-l450:was an inn up to the Second World War.{THE COTTAGE:}is a Queen Anne House.{THE GEORGE INN:}an l8th century coaching inn with a stable yard. { }
